metadata.synopsis: Karlach and Wyll meet at the camp and start a discussion. If not defused by the player it could escalate to Wyll or Karlach permanently leaving the party hostile.
metadata.how_to_trigger: Start a game as any character but Wyll or Karlach, recruit them using the debug book and go to camp.

68.context:
CinematicNodeContext: [opening, face-to-face]

Wyll and Karlach stand facing one another, fists clenched.

62.speaker: Wyll
62.text: One horn. The stink of Avernus. Advocatus diaboli.

8.speaker: Karlach
8.text: Well I'll be godsdamned - the Blade of Frontiers. Thought I'd shaken you for good. That'll teach me to underestimate you.

6.speaker: Wyll
6.text: Karlach. The archdevil Zariel's gladiator, come to burn the Sword Coast to ash.

27.speaker: Player
27.text: You've got it all wrong, Wyll. Karlach's not about to hurt anyone.

17.speaker: Karlach
17.text: Well - not counting the fuckers that need a good hurting.

26.speaker: Player
26.text: The two of you have met before, I see.

78.speaker: Karlach
78.text: If by 'met' you mean hoofing it through the Hells with this fucker on my tail.

11.speaker: Player
11.text: I brought you your target, Wyll. Why don't you do the honours?

16.speaker: Wyll
16.text: Shut it, devil - I know your kind. A heart darker than a shadow's nightmares. You'd cut a child's throat just to taste the blood.

55.speaker: Karlach
55.text: A devil? I didn't take the Blade for a fool. I'm - ngh!

35.speaker: Narrator
35.text: *A great fire roars through you - the fire of the First Hell.*
35.context: CinematicNodeContext: Hands to temples, mindmeld is happening

70.speaker: Narrator
70.text: *You are Karlach, tearing through demons across a blood-red landscape of fire and volcanic cinder.*
70.context: CinematicNodeContext: Hands to temples, mindmeld is happening

108.speaker: Narrator
108.text: *The front lines of the Blood War. With every swing of her axe, Karlach fulfils mistress Zariel's purpose.*
108.context: CinematicNodeContext: Hands to temples, mindmeld is happening

7.speaker: Wyll
7.text: Proof, clear as summer sky. It's over, Karlach. It's time you feel the sting of the Blade.

2.speaker: Karlach
2.text: I've tried to tell you - I'm not what you think I am.

41.speaker: Narrator
41.text: *Another vision. Karlach's blade raised, slicing through devils - Zariel's servants - as her eyes dart around, seeking escape.*
41.context: CinematicNodeContext: Hands to temples, mindmeld is happening

74.speaker: Narrator
74.text: *Wyll shudders with Karlach's desperation. She is a victim of the Blood War, not an agent of it.*
74.context: CinematicNodeContext: Hands to temples, mindmeld is happening

91.speaker: Wyll
91.text: By Balduran's helm, I - no. I will not be tricked!
91.context: NodeContext: Questioning himself. He has learned the 'monster' he hunts is a victim, but he still ready to attack

64.speaker: Karlach
64.text: You saw the truth. I may be an effective soldier, but I never wanted to serve Zariel. Legged it away from her the first chance I got.

38.speaker: Player
38.text: Stand down. You saw what I saw - Karlach is not a danger.

98.speaker: Player
98.text: Be practical. She's infected, same as us. We need allies, not enemies.

96.speaker: Player
96.text: I should never have trusted you, Karlach. You're as good as dead.

94.speaker: Player
94.text: You want a fight Wyll? I'll give you one.

46.speaker: Player
46.text: Fine, but he needs to stand down. We saw the truth for ourselves.

28.speaker: Narrator
28.text: *Wyll catches his breath, and his lips straighten. Sheer dread twists his face.*
28.context: CinematicNodeContext: Wyll catches his breath, and his face hardens. Signs of worry, fear - even sheer dread.

21.speaker: Wyll
21.text: No. Devils can not be trusted!

1.speaker: Player
1.text: Gods, you're stubborn. Karlach's not a devil, and you know it.

73.speaker: Player
73.text: You saw Karlach's thoughts. She poses no threat to the Sword Coast.

32.speaker: Karlach
32.text: You know monsters better than anyone. Can't you look in my eyes and see I'm not a devil?

12.speaker: Wyll
12.text: You don't know what this means. You don't know what you're asking me to do.
12.context: NodeContext: Fighting with himself. He doesn't want to believe it. Not killing Karlach means punishment from Mizora

4.speaker: Karlach
4.text: I'm asking you to live, Wyll. I don't want to hurt you. And, to be frank, I'd rather not find out how the Blade got his name.

53.speaker: Karlach
53.text: I swear to you, on all I am, I'm not what you think.

56.speaker: Wyll
56.context: CinematicNodeContext: There's a pause, and then Wyll swears. He realises he has resigned himself to becoming a devil himself. He's upset - but he knows he did the right thing. He relaxes into a neutral position.

83.speaker: Wyll
83.text: You really are no devil, are you? I've... I've been deceived.

20.speaker: Karlach
20.text: Thank the gods. Thought I was going to have to take your head.
20.context: NodeContext: Relieved Wyll is seeing sense. Calming down from her anger.

100.speaker: Wyll
100.text: You would've died in the attempt. But - there have been enough threats today.

3.speaker: Karlach
3.context: NodeContext: A little bit of uncertainty, hoping Wyll is calming down

48.speaker: Wyll
48.context: NodeContext: Resigned to his fate but knows he's making the right decision in not attacking Karlach.

67.speaker: Wyll
67.text: I see the good in you, Karlach. I promise not to lose sight of it, even when the Hells burn hottest.

107.speaker: Player
107.text: You're right. Let's cut her down before she causes any trouble.

93.speaker: Wyll
93.text: It's done, Karlach. By my living soul, you will forever burn.

101.speaker: Karlach
101.text: You know, I could've used a few friends. Pity that won't be any of you.

60.speaker: Player
60.text: It's you I don't trust, Wyll. You wanted a fight? You've got it.

51.speaker: Karlach
51.text: How about we all take a nice deep breath and calm the fuck down. Just cause I want to live doesn't mean I want him dead.

84.speaker: Player
84.text: Fine, but he needs to stand down. We saw the truth for ourselves.

81.speaker: Karlach
81.text: Would you listen to sense? This doesn't have to end badly - for either of us.

15.speaker: Player
15.text: But I do. The Blade of Frontiers will be only a memory come tomorrow.

31.speaker: Wyll
31.text: To the Hells with you, then - and may you all forever burn.

19.speaker: Karlach
19.text: Well I'll be godsdamned - the Blade of Frontiers. Thought I'd shaken you for good. That'll teach me to underestimate you.

99.speaker: Astarion
99.context: NodeContext: Realising Karlach and Wyll had met in the past (Wyll tried to kill Karlach)

33.speaker: Lae'zel
33.text: I see you've met. Saves me the trouble of introductions.

43.speaker: Karlach
43.text: If by 'met' you mean hoofing it through the Hells with this fucker on my tail.

106.speaker: Karlach
106.text: Look - it's an honour to be chased by a famed hero. I'm no devil, though. Not by a long shot.

97.speaker: Wyll
97.text: My sources say otherwise. Not a devil? Prove it.

103.speaker: Karlach
103.text: How should I do that exactly? Carve out my soul to serve with a nice side of turnips?

36.speaker: Wyll
36.text: You fight in the Blood War for Zariel. You'll bring the Blood War to the Coast.

75.speaker: Karlach
75.text: Yeah, I stowed away on a mind flayer ship so I could bring the war home. Makes perfect sense.

57.speaker: Karlach
57.text: If you'd just hear me out -

58.speaker: Narrator
58.text: *A great fire roars through you - the fire of the First Hell.*
58.context: CinematicNodeContext: Hands to temples, mindmeld is happening

66.speaker: Narrator
66.text: *Her rage and desperation seep into you. She is a victim of the Blood War, not an agent of it.*
66.context: CinematicNodeContext: Hands to temples, mindmeld is happening

88.speaker: Karlach
88.text: Fuck. I'll never get used to that.

49.speaker: Karlach
49.text: Look, whatever else it may be, the tadpole isn't a liar. I never wanted to serve Zariel, and I escaped the first chance I could. So stand down.
49.context: CinematicNodeContext: Gears herself up for battleNodeContext: Ready for a fight if needed.

34.speaker: Shadowheart
34.text: Let's take things down a notch, shall we? She's no devil, Wyll. You'll have to look elsewhere to find fodder for your blade.

25.speaker: Wyll
25.text: How can I make peace with the monster I was sent to kill?

92.speaker: Karlach
92.text: You know monsters, right? Better than anyone. Look into my eyes. Can't you see I'm not what you think?

30.speaker: Narrator
30.text: *Two souls hang in the balance. Kill Karlach, fulfil your contract - and condemn a possible innocent to the Hells. Or spare her and face the repercussions with Mizora.*

54.speaker: Wyll
54.text: Dammit. This is an unwelcome complication.

42.speaker: Wyll
42.text: It will mean my undoing, but... I believe you.

14.speaker: Karlach
14.text: Thank the gods, he sees sense! Look, Blade - Wyll - I know you love bashing evil - we have that in common.

0.speaker: Karlach
0.text: Friends? I've gathered quite the collection.

80.speaker: Karlach
80.text: Well met. Now let's kick some arse while there's still arse to be kicked.

5.speaker: Wyll
5.text: Let's start at allies and work from there.

82.speaker: Karlach
82.text: I can live with that. Besides, I enjoy winning hard cases over.

45.speaker: Karlach
45.text: Touchy, touchy. But hey, I spent a decade in Avernus surrounded by imps and devils. Winning you over will be child's play.

87.speaker: Wyll
87.text: Save your breath. Let's see if this devil bleeds.

85.speaker: Karlach
85.text: You know, I could've used a few friends. Pity that won't be any of you.

89.speaker: Wyll
89.text: I'm sorry, Karlach. There's too much at stake.

104.speaker: Wyll
104.text: You don't know what this means. You don't know what you're asking me to do.

69.speaker: Karlach
69.text: I'm asking you to live, Wyll. I don't want to hurt you. And, to be frank, I'd rather not find out how the Blade got his name.

105.speaker: Karlach
105.text: I swear to you, on all I am, I'm not what you think.

102.speaker: Wyll
102.text: No. No second-guessing. The devil dies - now.

13.speaker: Karlach
13.text: Too bad. I thought maybe you could be a friend. I could've done with one of those.

65.speaker: Gale
65.text: Easy, Wyll. She's no devil. There's no fight to be had here.

72.speaker: Astarion
72.text: Now, now, children - let's not lose our heads. Figuratively or literally.
72.context: NodeContext: Wyll and Karlach are ready to fight and kill each other. Astarion speaks up to try and stop them

52.speaker: Lae'zel
52.text: Control yourself, Wyll. I understand bloodthirst. But this is no time to quench it.

9.speaker: Wyll
9.text: I've hunted you to the Hells and beyond. It ends here, Karlach.

79.speaker: Karlach
79.text: For fuck's sake, you must be half troll to have a skull that thick.

76.speaker: Shadowheart
76.text: You two have met before, I take it?

90.speaker: Gale
90.text: You two have met before, I take it?
